subject: Management
title: Setting Ground Rules
description: A fast breakdown of Setting Ground Rules for builders.

hook.text: A mediation session turned into a shouting match within two minutes. No rules had been set.

buildup.text: Without ground rules, difficult conversations follow the path of least resistance: escalation.

discovery.text: Simple rules: one person speaks at a time, no personal attacks, focus on behavior not character.

twist.text: Rules feel awkward to state. But they create the safety needed for honesty.

climax.text: Start every mediation with: here's how we'll have this conversation. Agreement on process enables progress.

punchline.text: Set the rules before the emotions arrive.

quiz.question: Why are ground rules important at the start of mediation?
options: They create safety and prevent escalation during difficult talks
They ensure the mediator controls the entire conversation
They eliminate the need for follow-up conversations
